alert.note: Alert for Prowers (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 07 at 7:23PM MDT until June 07 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Prowers County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 830 PM MDT. * At 722 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 15 miles north of Two Buttes Reservoir, or 17 miles southeast of Lamar, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. This storm has a history of producing tornadoes earlier. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Prowers County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
